original_query: Query 1: Find the main differences between Mercedes Benz S Class and BMW 7 Series. Give it back to me in html format, with beautiful formatting.

[trafilatura] BMW 7 Series vs Mercedes-Benz S-Class
Overview | |
Years produced1994-Present | Years produced1977-1979 |
MSRP$114,500 | MSRP$96,400 |
Average price$49,491 | Average price$39,045 |
Listings5516 | Listings3634 |
Ratings & Reviews | |
User Reviews | User Reviews |
Expert reviews8.5 out of 10 | Expert reviews6.7 out of 10 |
Pros
| Pros
|
Reviews SummaryWhen it comes to good design, even better luxury, and stellar performance, its tough to beat the three-pointed star. The S-Class is a few years into its latest generation, but Mercedes trotted out a new powertrain for 2023. Its not a full battery-electric vehicle, for that youll want the EQS, but for many consumers the plug-in hybrid can be a convenient stop-gap for those not ready to commit to leaving the gas station behind for good. | |
Reviews SummaryRedesigned for 2023, the 7 Series is BMW's full-size flagship sedan, arch-rival to the Mercedes-Benz S-Class, Audi A8, and newcomers like the Genesis G90. For 2024, BMW has added the plug-in hybrid (PHEV) 750e and lightly updated the infotainment system. Unfortunately, these additions don't change the 7 Series calculus. The 750e offers a boost in power and efficiency over the low-end 740i, but it costs more, has a disjointed driving personality, and quickly eats its electric charge. Despite the update, the car's digital systems remain frustratingly complex. Verdict: The 2024 BMW 7 Series has lots to offer luxury buyers, including features like a rear-seat theatre and cashmere upholstery, plus performance and fuel efficiency that are often superior to most rivals, few of whom offer PHEV options. But the car's frustrating digital systems and controls undermine the experience. | |
No video found | No video found |

perception.result_requirement: Comparison of differences between Mercedes Benz S Class and BMW 7 Series in HTML format.
perception.reasoning: Successfully extracted content from some URLs, providing data for comparison. However, one URL was blocked. The extracted data seems to have some comparison overview. Since the user wants the result in HTML format, it cannot be directly represented in the next tool use. I will skip to summarization. I will use available comparison data for summarization in HTML.
perception.local_reasoning: Extracted data from multiple sources, including price, engine, and other feature comparisons. User wanted in html format, I will direct to summarizer and create summary in html
perception.last_tooluse_summary: webpage_url_to_raw_text extracted comparison data from multiple sources but faced blocking on one URL.
perception.instruction_to_summarize: Generate an HTML formatted comparison of the Mercedes Benz S Class and BMW 7 Series using the extracted data. Focus on aspects like pricing, engine specifications, dimensions, and user/expert reviews. Use the data from the successful extractions to create a detailed comparison table in HTML format. Provide a visually appealing and structured comparison.

data.description: Summarize the extracted content to identify key differences between the two car models.
Format the identified differences into HTML.
